root.query: select * from m_work_contents order by work_contents_code

SELECT t1.*,t2.theme_name1,t2.theme_name2,t3.work_contents_code,t3.work_contents_code_name FROM t_manhour t1 JOIN m_theme t2 ON t1.theme_no = t2.theme_no JOIN m_work_contents t3 ON t3.work_contents_class = t1.work_contents_class WHERE t1.year = 2021 AND t1.month = 7 AND t1.user_no = '01'
ORDER BY t2.theme_no

select * from (SELECT MH.user_no, MH.Day1,MH.Day2,MH.Day3,MH.Day4,MH.Day5,MH.Day6,MH.Day7,MH.Day8,MH.Day9,MH.Day10,MH.Day11,MH.Day12,MH.Day13,MH.Day14,MH.Day15,MH.Day16,MH.Day17,MH.Day18,MH.Day19,MH.Day20,MH.Day21,MH.Day22,MH.Day23,MH.Day24,MH.Day25,MH.Day26,MH.Day27,MH.Day28,MH.Day29,MH.Day30,MH.Day31 ,Case WHEN MH.month >= 0 AND MH.month <= 9 THEN concat(MH.year,'0',MH.month ) WHEN MH.month >= 10 Then concat(MH.year,Cast(MH.month as text) ) END as duration FROm public.t_manhour as MH) as tem INNER Join public.m_processing_month as pm On duration = pm.processing_month WHERE tem.user_no = user_no
AND tem.user_no = :user_no
ORDER BY tem.user_no ASC LIMIT 1

SELECT * FROM (SELECT DISTINCT(cal.date), cal.horiday, u.user_no, u.site_code, date_part('year', cal.date) as YearConver, date_part('month', cal.date) as MonthConver FROM public.m_calendar as cal Join public.m_user as U ON U.site_code = cal.site_code) as tem WHERE 1 = 1
AND tem.user_no =:user_no
AND tem.YearConver =:currentYear
AND tem.MonthConver =:currentMonth

SELECT * FROM public.t_manhour as MH WHERE 1 = 1
AND MH.user_no = :user_no
AND MH.year = :year
AND MH.month = :month

SELECT U.user_no ,U.role_code ,U.site_code ,U.group_code FROM public.m_user as U WHERE
U.user_no = :user_no
